contextId.information: This is God's blessing. He told the sea animals to produce more sea animals like themselves, so that there would be many of them in the seas. The word "multiply" explains how they are to be "fruitful." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that God made mankind to be like him. This verse does not tell in what ways God made people to be like himself. God does not have a body, so it does not mean that people would look like God. AT: "to truly be like us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
contextId.quote: in our image, after our likeness

contextId.information: God told the man and the woman to produce more people like themselves so that there would be many of them. The word "multiply" explains how they are to be "fruitful." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:22|1:22]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"because he wounded me ... because he bruised me" or "because he hurt me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: for wounding me ... for bruising me

contextId.information: This is an idiom. See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:28|1:28]]. God wanted the humans and animals to reproduce, so there would be many of them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This is God's blessing. He told Noah and his family to produce more humans like themselves, so that there would be many of them. The word "multiply" explains how they are to be "fruitful." See how you translated these commands in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:28|1:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Be fruitful, multiply, and fill the earth

contextId.information: The words "fear" and "dread" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how afraid the animals will be of mankind. AT: "A dreadful fear of you" or "A terrible fear of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: The fear of you and the dread of you

contextId.information: This is God's blessing. He told Noah and his family to produce more humans like themselves, so that there would be many of them. The word "multiply" explains how they are to be "fruitful." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:28|1:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Both of these phrases mean that Isaac married Rebekah. AT: "and married Rebekah" or "and took her as his wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: and took Rebekah, and she became his wife

contextId.information: "Abraham took his last breath and died." The phrases "breathed his last" and "died" mean basically the same thing. AT: "Abraham died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Abraham breathed his last and died

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Abraham lived a very long time. AT: "when he had lived a very long time and was very old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: at a good old age, an old man with a full life

contextId.information: The terms "breathed his last" and "died" mean basically the same thing. AT: "died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The word "multiply" explains how God would make Jacob "fruitful." AT: "give you many children and descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: make you fruitful and multiply you

contextId.information: The phrase "the gate of heaven" explains that this place is the entrance to "the house of God" and "the entrance to where God lives." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: the house of God ... the gate of heaven

contextId.information: God told Jacob to produce children so that there would be many of them. The word "multiply" explains how he was to be "fruitful." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:22|1:22]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

"Isaac took his last breath and died." The phrases "breathed his last" and "died" mean basically the same thing. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:25:07|25:08]]. AT: "Isaac died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Isaac breathed his last and died

contextId.information: Both of the words have same meaning. They refer to Joseph's pleasing appearance. He was likely good-looking and strong. AT: "handsome and strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The word "multiplied" explains how they were "fruitful." AT: "They had very many children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: They were fruitful and multiplied greatly

contextId.information: The phrase "multiply you" explains how God would make Jacob "fruitful." AT: "I will give you very many descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: I will make you fruitful, and multiply you
